intro: Psychotria articulicymosa, commonly known as the "soul of the forest," is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that contains numerous seeds. Psychotria articulicymosa is often found in shaded, moist environments within tropical rainforests.
